intro: Cheiridopsis comptonii, commonly known as the Compton's ice plant, is a succulent native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its fleshy leaves and vibrant flowers. The plant features small, blue or purple flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are covered in a fine layer of white powder, which helps reduce water loss. It is well adapted to arid environments and thrives in full sun with minimal water.
